paper.title: Modelling diffusion of innovation curves using radiocarbon data
paper.authors: Crema, E.R., Bloxam, A., Stevens, C.J., Vander Linden, M.

comprehensibility.rationale: All methodological claims explicit and bounded. Technical terms operationally defined with mathematical precision. Clear argument structure.

transparency.rationale: Full mathematical specification. Complete priors, MCMC settings, simulation parameters. Code available with independent review.

plausibility.rationale: Grounded in established diffusion theory. Case studies from well-researched contexts. Anomalies acknowledged and contextualised.

validity.rationale: Pre-specified simulation validation with known parameters. Evidence directly addresses methodological hypotheses.

robustness.rationale: Dual-model triangulation provides robustness evidence. Comprehensive sensitivity analysis not systematically documented.

generalisability.rationale: Method scope clearly bounded. Case study boundaries explicit. Transfer conditions specified through code documentation.

reproducibility.rationale: Complete data and code with DOIs. Independent code review. Workflow fully documented. Priority 1 for reproduction attempt.

strengths: Exemplary transparency with full mathematical specification
Dual archival (GitHub + Zenodo DOI) with independent code review
Pre-specified simulation validation before empirical application
Clear verification targets for reproduction (Table 1 parameter estimates)
limitations: Package dependencies not explicitly listed in paper text
Comprehensive sensitivity analysis not systematically documented
Proxy assumption (seed dates as farming practice indicator) acknowledged but not quantified
